PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET9094 - Customer Case Study on American Tire Distributor (ATD): Migrating to the Software-Defined Data Center with Arista Networks and VMware NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
The best-of-breed physical and virtual networking solutions from Arista Networks and VMware NSX radically simplifies, optimizes and accelerates the entire application deployment lifecycle. With single point of integration between physical and virtual elements, deep network and application visibility, an open ecosystem model, and fully automated infrastructure, customers can drive down cost and complexity while driving up operational efficiency.
Many IT organizations have started the migration from existing legacy architectures to these new Software Defined Data Center architectures. There is a wealth of knowledge gained from their experiences that can be shared with others organizations who are considering similar migrations in their own future.
This session will highlight the data center environment at American Tire Distributor (ATD), Inc., as a real-world customer case study and example of this type of migration. ATD engineering lead will share his experience in migrating from their legacy data center architecture toward a modern physical + virtual architecture leveraging Arista EOS and VMware NSX integrated software defined data center solution. ATD will be joined by Arista and VMware in this joint presentation covering key migration steps and lessons learned in migrating both the physical underlay and the virtual overlay.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET9069 - Automating Traffic Visibility for the Software-Defined Data Center
PresentationDetailsList.Description: With more than 80% of the workloads in the data center expected to be virtual in 2016, and 80% of this traffic being east-west, a primary challenge for centralized monitoring infrastructure is to access this virtual traffic for application, network, and security analysis. In addition, next-generation private clouds powered by VMware NSX are being designed from the ground up for scale and agility, and VM-to-Host consolidation ratios are touching 50:1 to 100:1. Thus, the SecOps and NetOps teams that are charted to secure, record, and analyze this traffic are demanding automated and continuous visibility of these virtual workloads. This session describes how the ITOps teams can automate traffic visibility for the SDDC, leveraging VMware NSX Dynamic Service Insertion and Gigamon Security Delivery Platform (SDP), while preserving the security and monitoring investments. A use case for a large federal civilian agency automating their traffic visibility will also be discussed to illustrate the technical details and business benefits.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC8081 - Healthcare: The Security Awakens
PresentationDetailsList.Description: A 2015 Experian study stated that data breaches cost the healthcare industry $5.6 billion every year. Healthcare security is a design principle, not a product, so healthcare IT must build security into every system to provide a better and more secure experience. Minimizing security breaches avoids money being spent on fines and fixing problems, allowing it to be directed back into new and innovative IT projects and improved patient care and provider satisfaction. Healthcare IT security involves lifecycle management of applications. From inception to the end of individual applications' functional life, every aspect must be standardized, secured, and monitored. This session will challenge you to take a new look at your healthcare systems and how you are designing and deploying systems and applications. Improving your security posture—not through products but through principles—enables your providers to focus on patient care, not public relations.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC8667 - Deep Dive into Real-Life Data-Center Breaches and How They Could Have Been Avoided
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Changing with the times is frequently overlooked when it comes to data center security. Technology is becoming increasingly dynamic, but most data centers still use archaic security measures to protect their network, which doesn't provide sufficient protection against today's sophisticated attacks. Data centers house a huge amount of sensitive data, and thus there shouldn't be any shortcomings when implementing security to protect these environments. The focus has traditionally been on adding protection only at the perimeter to keep threats outside, but implementing perimeter-centric security leaves the inside of the data center vulnerable. Cybercriminals are constantly using advanced techniques to target assets inside the data center. Once inside, they are able to freely propagate their malware against other internal assets. Without upgrading data center security protections with advanced multilayered threat prevention and zero-day protections, hackers gain visibility and access to steal data and disrupt business processes before they are even detected. Join our session where will share more about recent data center breaches -- where lateral movement and sophisticated techniques were used -- and detail how organizations can prevent the next attack by using mirco-segmentation along with advanced multilayered threat prevention in the software-defined data center.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8832 - The Role of VIO and NSX in Virtualizing the Telecoms Infrastructure
PresentationDetailsList.Description: What can we take from enterprise IT and cloud services experiences to help communication service providers accelerate their Network Function Virtualization (NFV) projects? Where is the overlap? This session will review architecture and component choices, such as VMware Integrated OpenStack (VIO) and NSX, to quickly bring NFV services to market.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8189 - VMware NSX and Pivotal Cloud Foundry
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Pivotal Cloud Foundry, the leading platform in the platform-as-a service (PaaS) market, makes it possible to deploy and update complex applications with a simple "CF push" (Cloud Foundry CLI). Deploying Cloud Foundry in a VMware vSphere environment is also highly automated, aside from the network setup, which must be manually configured. Using VMware NSX we can automate the deployment of the needed network topology to support a Cloud Foundry deployment, including fine-grained firewall rules to secure and protect both the PaaS infrastructure and PaaS-based applications. This session will go into the details of networking within the Cloud Foundry PaaS platform and explain the benefits gained in manageability and security from using NSX with Cloud Foundry. The technical details of the implementation will be covered, including live demos.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8194 - How VMware IT Implemented Microsegmentation and Deployed a Large-Scale Private Cloud Using NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware IT implemented microsegmentation using VMware NSX distributed firewall to secure production applications and deployed VMware NSX in a large-scale internal private cloud environment. We will review use cases for microsegmentation, such as SAP, and discuss design considerations. We will outline our approach for finalizing the firewall policy model using VMware vRealize Log Insight for firewall traffic monitoring and analytics and discuss roles and responsibilities and lessons learned. Join us to learn how VMware secured its business services by leveraging NSX and scaled its internal private cloud deployment using NSX features. We will discuss the design, technical, and organizational considerations of one of the world's largest deployments of NSX for VMware vSphere (hosting more than 20,000 virtual machines). We will review the decisions involved in deploying new NSX environments and how VMware's internal private cloud leverages NSX edge firewalling to achieve a scalable, multitenant security model.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8131R - NSX for vSphere Logical Routing Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The VMware NSX for vSphere platform brings agility to networking by decoupling the logical network space from the physical infrastructure. This session discusses how Layer 3 (L3) communication can be enabled between virtual and physical workloads. This session will offer technical detail (including packet walks) on how L3 communication is enabled in logical space. This is done both for intra-data center traffic flows (E-W traffic flows) as well as communication to the external L3 physical infrastructure (N-S traffic flows). This session will also go over deployment models and VMware vSphere High Availability options.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7861R - Multisite Networking and Security with Cross-vCenter NSX: Part 2
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Cross-VC NSX enables logical networking and security across multiple vCenter domains/sites and provides enhanced solutions for multi-site deployments. In Part 2 of this session, we’ll discuss Cross-VC NSX Security, failure/recovery scenarios, and how automation can be leveraged in Cross-VC NSX environments for specific use cases/scenarios.We’ll walk through examples of Cross-VC NSX security. Further, we’ll step through the process of automating Failover/Recovery and take a look at how automation using different tools can be leveraged to handle the process. A demo will be shown covering some of the discussion points.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8758 - vSphere Distributed Switch Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The VMware vSphere Distributed Switch (VDS) is widely used today. This session covers the architecture and key benefits of VDS. Attendees learn about VDS features and VDS migration strategies. A quick overview of how NSX enhances VDS capabilities for logical networks will be covered as well.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC7593 - NSX Security for Horizon View 7—Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This updated session will familiarize security architects and operators with the security features of VMware NSX 6.2.x and how they apply to the VMware Horizon View 7 environment. We will review in detail the use of virtual networks to provide network segmentation, distributed firewall, identity firewall, and Service Composer for policy automation. We will also take a look at multi-data center scenarios. We will then apply these services to our reference architecture and illustrate the automation of policies for different groups of users of the virtual desktop infrastructure environment.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET9447-SPO - Extensible Solution for Software Driven Data Centers (SDDC) with VMware and Arista
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Arista Networks and VMware have pioneered the networking industry with its software defined networking approach. Arista Networks and VMware have partnered closely to deliver the industry first fully integrated best-of-breed solution for the Software Driven Data Center. This fully integrated solution leverages core data center virtualization technologies along with Arista unique network-wide approach through CloudVision to transform data center economics and business agility through automation and non-disruptive deployment that embraces existing infrastructure investments. This joint solution radically simplifies, optimizes and accelerates the entire application deployment lifecycle. With single point of integration between physical and virtual elements, deep network and application visibility, an open ecosystem model, and fully automated infrastructure, customers can drive down cost and complexity while driving up operational efficiency Customers can benefit from some of the unique capabilities of this joint solution like interconnecting physical infrastructure with vSphere, vCloud Director, VMware NSX, and OpenStack, leveraging vRealize Operations to monitor overall health of entire data center, tracing traffic flows across physical and virtual nodes, correlating events between underlay and overlay at real time, and securing data center workloads with micro-segmentation while still enhancing data center perimeter security at the same time. Come see how two visionaries are defining the next generation Software Defined Data Center with a Software Driven Cloud Network.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7854R - Multisite Networking and Security with Cross-vCenter NSX—Part 1
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Learn how Cross-vCenter NSX (Cross-VC NSX) enables logical networking and security across multiple vCenter domains/sites and how it provides enhanced solutions for specific use cases. No longer is logical networking and security constrained to a single vCenter domain.We’ll step through an overview of the Cross-VC NSX feature and discuss architecture, components, and deployment models. We’ll also cover design topics and demonstrate how Cross-VC NSX can be used for multi-site solutions. A demo will be shown covering some of the discussion points.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8030 - NSX Performance Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: What kind of performance can one really expect from the network virtualization solution: VMware NSX? Can we expect NSX to take advantage of and drive throughput saturating 40Gb Ethernet network cards? What features should be considered? What parameters should be tuned? What kind of latency can we expect? If these are some of the questions you are looking answers for to, then this is the session for you. This session will walk you through real world performance expectations and results for NSX, a network virtualization solution helping customers implement networking and security services in software on commodity network and compute infrastructure. We will take a look at the characteristics of physical and virtual networking devices—how are they similar and what makes them different—and benchmarking considerations when testing NSX. We will also take a close look at hardware considerations and tuning recommendations to achieve best performance.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC9450-SPO - Bridging the Gap between Infrastructure and Security Operations
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Financial Information Systems (FIS) was established to support the business and financial operations of one of the oldest institutions of higher learning in the country, the University of Pittsburgh. Like many organizations, FIS found that the information asymmetry between infrastructure and security operations teams often made it difficult to identify and remediate possible threats persisting and propagating throughout the data center. The lag time between the identification of an infrastructure problem and when it was ultimately correlated to a root cause security incident was costly in terms of the impact to an organization. Hear the case study of how the University of Pittsburgh FIS team began utilizing VMware vRealize in order to centrally manage their on-premise virtualized environments and their public cloud deployments. Find out how they were able to enhance visibility of their modern data center system performance and the security controls they used to protect it – correlating operational and security incidents across their data center in a single view. Attendees will hear the lessons that the University FIS group learned in the process of implementing this solution and how this ability to quickly identify and assess potential threats and manage and deploy security efficiently has increased their effectiveness in mitigating incidents with minimal impact to the organization.

Presenters.Name: Richard Abbott, Trend Micro Canada Technologies Inc.
Presenters.LastName: Richard Abbott, Trend Micro Canada Technologies Inc.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8109 - Amadeus's Journey Building a Software-Defined Data Center with VMware Integrated OpenStack and NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Amadeus IT Group, a multinational IT provider for global travel and tourism with over €3 billion in revenue, undertook a transformational project to modernize its infrastructure. In this session we will go through some of the drivers for the project (building a new hotel guest reservation system using Red Hat OpenShift platform as a service) and the technology choices evaluated for the project. You will learn how and why Amadeus chose OpenStack over AWS Virtual Private Cloud with Chef/Puppet-based automation.
After reviewing the decision to go with OpenStack, we will look at why Amadeus decided to go with VMware Integrated OpenStack and NSX for this critical project. We will then share the high-level design and best practices Amadeus implemented and learned from this project.
At the end of this session you will understand how Amadeus has been successful in leveraging OpenStack to support a transformational initiative for the business to support both traditional virtual machine-based workloads and new cloud native applications based on Red Hat OpenShift.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7701 - How to Easily Become a Cool Automation NSX Cloud Network Engineer
PresentationDetailsList.Description: You have been designing / deploying / maintaining data centers for many years using SSH connections to switches/routers and some other CLI/UI to firewalls + load balancers and even some more CLI/UI to SSL-VPN appliances. And each time you have to deploy a new app it takes you few weeks (and headaches when you have to troubleshoot anything). 4 years ago Network Virtualization emerged and started offering Network and Security services all from a central UI. A new application deployment is now 15 minutes via "click-click-click" and with much simpler central troubleshooting! Last but not least, Network Virtualization with scripting tools like Python allows automation to deploy applications in seconds!!!This session will review in details the benefits of Network Virtualization and explain to newbies how to simply start automation of network and security services with python NSX plugin.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7514 - PowerNSX and PyNSXv: Using PowerShell and Python for Automation and Management of VMware NSX for vSphere
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Regardless of whether you are a Windows guru, or dream in awk and sed, there are powerful command-line and scripting tools as well as programing language bindings available to you for managing VMware NSX for vSphere environments. This session will take a light hearted but informative look at two tools, PowerNSX and PyNSXv, that enable you to query, manage, manipulate and automate your VMware NSX for vSphere platforms. Whether you are a PowerShell Guru or a Python Savant, this session has you covered. Leave any preconceptions or bias at the door, as through a series of comparative demonstrations, we will demonstrate the real power and flexibility that command-line, scripting tools and language bindings can bring to a VMware NSX for vSphere environment, regardless of which camp you come from.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC10020 - Managing Cybersecurity Risks Within SDDC: VMware and Palo Alto Networks Customers Discuss Their Perspectives and Experiences with NSX and VM-Series Deployments
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Most organizations realize that cybersecurity risks are an imminent cost of doing business. VMware and Palo Alto Networks have partnered to address these risks within a software defined data center and businesses are actively implementing the joint integration as an effective mitigation strategy. Bring your questions to this interactive panel of Southern California Edison, SugarCreek Packing Co, Washington Federal and Vallejo Sanitation to discuss:
• How VMware NSX and Palo Alto Networks VM-Series helped their journey to manage cyber threat risks within their infrastructure
• Best practices to follow while leveraging the joint integration
• And share some of the lessons learnt during their journey

Presenters.Name: Sai Balabhadrapatruni, Palo Alto Networks, Moderator
Presenters.LastName: Sai Balabhadrapatruni, Palo Alto Networks, Moderator

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC9619-SPO - Scale and Segment the Agile Data Center with Software-Defined Security and NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Data center transformation with server and network virtualization are leading to agile IT environments that accelerate business initiatives and deliver more responsive applications. But more abstract and logical networks create visibility and control challenges for traditional hardware security appliances designed to sit statically at physical network chokepoints.

How can security itself be made more elastic and agile in Software-Defined Data Centers? A vision for Software-Defined Security is introduced, and a three-part framework will outline how network security is evolving across all layers of the network architecture, from the data plane to the control plane to the management plane. A tightly integrated approach to orchestrating intrusion prevention, next-generation firewall and advanced Layer-7 security with VMware vSphere and NSX is demonstrated, along with a deep dive on actual customer use cases. Further considerations such as multi-tenancy and on-demand protection are explored for service providers or enterprise IT-as-a-service teams looking towards "security-as-a-service” delivery models.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC9177 - A Real World Deployment of VMware NSX in the DMZ
PresentationDetailsList.Description: How do you best secure your DMZ in an environment critical not just to your company but to your country? How do you best leverage your existing investments in network and security? How do you adapt your existing security model to match the capabilities made possible by VMware NSX? This session covers a real-world customer deployment and attempt to answer these questions. Learn why VMware NSX was chosen to secure the DMZ along with Palo Alto Networks, and how the existing F5 Load Balancers, Cisco Nexus network, and Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance firewalls are leveraged and integrated in this setup. Get a practical guide to how to get started with microsegmentation, and learn how to build the policies—and what works and what doesn't—from a customer who has actually tried it.

Presenters.Name: Brian Pietrewicz, University of New Mexico
Presenters.LastName: Brian Pietrewicz, University of New Mexico

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7648 - How PG&E is Automating Secure Environments with NSX, vRealize Automation, and vRealize Orchestrator
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
XaaS (Anything-as-a-Service) is the future of automation, and leveraging vRealize Automation drastically simplifies the creation and consumption of these services. By coupling vRealize Automations catalog driven service, with NSX workflow and API driven Software Defined Datacenter (SDDC) solution, the customizations PG&E has implemented have transformed their deployment process. They are now realizing reduced time to market, improved security, and greater agility in their platform and application deployments as well as improved user experience through self-service.
Join PG&E in this technical session to learn more about their custom designed workflows for vRealize Automation and NSX and how these customization have changed deployments at PG&E. We’ll talk about the touchpoints of these custom designed workflows, the platforms they integrate with, and the services that end users are consuming with these workflows. Finally we’ll touch on where PG&E cloud journey is going, and the automation opportunities on the horizon!

Presenters.Name: Cody De Arkland, Pacific Gas & Electric Company
Presenters.LastName: Cody De Arkland, Pacific Gas & Electric Company

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET9155 - NSX Policy, Visibility, and Intelligence
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Showcase for NSXv Policy, Visibility, and Intelligence

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8082 - NSX Operationalization: Monitoring and Troubleshooting Your NSX  Software Defined Data Center
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
VMware NSX empowers today's Software Defined Data Center (SDDC) to run agile clouds supporting dynamic and challenging business requirements. Designing and deploying NSX for day 1 is well understood and extensively documented. The focus of this session is to introduce the operational leads and engineers responsible for day 2 and ongoing operations to the many aspects of NSX that are specifically geared toward managing, monitoring, and troubleshooting the SDDC. 

NSX brings more visibility and transparency to this distributed system than traditional environments ever offered. We will show you the tools and methodologies available for various levels in your organizations, such as Level 1 support, Level 2 network operations center, Level 3 senior engineers, and Level 4 architects. We will also share operational best practices, tools, and documents used by organizations running NSX to support environments scaling to thousands of virtual machines.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET9029 - NSX Logical Load Balancing: From Basics to Fine Art
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Are you fully aware of the potential of the VMware NSX Server Load Balancing (SLB)? If you are looking for a thorough analysis of the evolution of SLBs and Application Delivery Controllers (ADCs), this is the session for you! Based on their combined 25+ years of experience with such devices, Gustavo Santana and Heath Parrott explain the main concepts behind this popular networking service, its integration in complex data center infrastructure, and all the design guidelines for an efficient application deployment using NSX logical load balancing. Other sessions topics include explanations on: * Traffic profile and load-balancing algorithms * Server behavior under stress * NSX Layer 4 load balancing * NSX Layer 5-7 load balancing * SSL offload and load balancing * Inline vs one-armed topologies * Distributed load balancing * Troubleshooting * ... and much more. As you will witness, the NSX logical load balancer, and its capability to be tied to automation, enables development and infrastructure teams to deploy fast and deploy often.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8337 - Leveraging NSX for Remote and Branch Offices
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Remote and branch offices typically are hard to manage and take time to provision. This session will cover how VMware NSX can be extended from the data center to your branch offices to solve management and deployment challenges and enable use cases such as microsegmentation and advanced security insertion.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8343 - OpenStack Networking in the Enterprise: Real-Life Use Cases
PresentationDetailsList.Description: OpenStack Neutron defines two major types of networks: tenant networks and provider networks. OpenStack administrators must decide what their Neutron network deployment strategy will leverage—tenant networks, provider networks, or some combination of the two. This session will describe the unique challenges presented by tenant networks in the private cloud context and will build an argument for why shared provider networks may provide the best Neutron network deployment strategy for enterprise private clouds. This session will also discuss the rationale behind the assertion that network security is now orthogonal to network topology (which, if true, is a significant factor leading to the viability of shared provider networks). Real-life customer examples will be presented and discussed.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC8022 - Implementing Agentless AV and IPS/IDS Security Solutions with NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: If you want to implement a comprehensive security posture and profile for your application by protecting workload with Agentless Antivirus, L2-L4 Distributed Firewall and IPS/IDS then this session is for you.This session will introduce you with the fundamental concepts first and then will show you how to quickly adopt them in your environment. We will share our experiences and best practices from implementations in production environments. This will be shown by using TrendMicro and Palo Alto Networks integration with NSX as examples.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9886-SPO - Modernize Remote/Branch Office (ROBO) Operations with Software-Defined Edge
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The datacenter is fast getting software-defined. But what about branch offices and remote edge locations that are connected to the datacenter and cloud? Hear from a panel of customers from different industries about how they have transformed their remote and branch office IT operations with a Software-Defined Edge strategy, extending the services, best practices, security, and resilience of their Software-Defined Data Centers to the edges of their business. Branch offices and remote locations are those front lines where business gets done, yet they’re typically far removed from the central and secure data center. To optimize branch productivity, IT teams must contend with the extraordinary costs and challenges of managing a highly distributed environment. A panel of IT leaders will talk about how they successfully combined the benefits of VMware Software-Defined Data Center and Riverbed Software-Defined Edge solutions to: • Centralize and secure data in the datacenter • Accelerate application performance at the remote sites • Reduce network bandwidth utilization • Ensure business continuity with near zero data loss and instant recovery • Increase operational agility with instant provisioning • Slash operational costs of edge IT with centralized management • Streamline branch infrastructure with hyper-converged appliance Attend this session to learn how you can modernize your edge IT with a Software-Defined Edge approach with which you can deliver data and applications to any edge location, anytime with a click of a few buttons. Customers use Riverbed solutions to deliver and optimize on-premise and cloud-based applications, infrastructure services, virtual desktops (VDI), security and threat-protection services, networking functions, SD-WAN, and more. You can get the application performance with the resilience and security while lowering operational complexity. These are conflicting goals with inherent trade-offs but it can be achieved. Attend and find out how.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC9446-SPO - Integrating a Threat Defense Lifecycle Security Approach with VMware NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware NSX brings an inherently better security model to the data center with automated fine-grained policies tied to the virtual machines. It enables micro-segmentation to significantly reduce the lateral spread of threats inside the data center. Still, security professionals face challenges keeping up with the agility provided by NSX and the Software Defined Data Center when using traditional security products and architectures not optimized for this data center environment. Intel Security and VMware have collaborated to automate security orchestration, while strengthening and unifying the threat defense lifecycle, and enabling threat intelligence sharing. In this session, Intel Security and VMware security experts will explain how this approach can be incorporated into the SDDC to increase security intelligence, provide visibility into inter- and intra-VM traffic, and streamline security management.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC8348 - Deploying Security in a Brownfield Environment
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This session will cover how VMware NSX can be deployed in an existing data center environment to address security use cases. The focus of the session will be on operationalizing the NSX distributed firewall and service insertion, best practices for creating a distributed firewall policy, and guidelines for migrating from an existing physical firewall to NSX.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7956 - vRealize Automation and NSX Design Best Practices
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Organizations require agility and operational efficiency, through end-to-end service automation including network and security. To deliver on this requirement NSX provides advanced and software-based switching, routing, firewalling and load balancing capabilities, plus partner integration. While vRealize Automation is capable of natively consuming these NSX features to allow efficient provisioning of services that include compute, storage, network, security and application components out of the box. This advanced technical session provides hands-on design details and experiences to get the best out of the vRealize Automation and NSX integration, including use cases, deployment considerations, supported network and security topologies, best practices and extensibility tips. Prior technical experience on these solutions is recommended.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8680R - Advanced NSX Troubleshooting: Tips & Tricks for Experienced Users
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The average cost of a data breach in the US is $5.8 million. Knowing how to troubleshoot key NSX features can not only improve security, but also give you more control of your networking environment. Give us an hour and we’ll give you an overview of the Command Line Interface (CLI) with detailed steps and commands you can use in your troubleshooting process. Then we’ll share six troubleshooting tips for critical areas of your NSX environment including host preparation, bootbank and boot process, ESXi Agency Manager (EAM), system events and logs, Virtual Extensible LAN (VXLAN) and controller pool.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7865 - Operational Best Practices for VMware NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: An increasing number of customers are migrating to a cloud based on a Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC). VMWare NSX is the key component of the SDDC solution: It provides the network virtualization capability. In this session, you will learn the opportunities for operational improvements that VMWare NSX presents to its users. You will also learn about a subset of the many tools that are available from VMWare and its partner ecosystem that takes advantage of this opportunity and provides you with better visibility than ever before.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8364R - How to Deploy VMware NSX with Cisco Infrastructure
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Many enterprises rely on both VMware vSphere and Cisco Nexus/UCS to build the foundation of their data center infrastructure. While VMware NSX brings advanced network automation and security capabilities to vSphere on any network infrastructure, this session will cover the NSX design considerations specific to environments using Cisco Nexus switches for the physical network, and Cisco UCS for the vSphere compute resources. This session will also show how to run NSX while utilizing the underlay functionality of Cisco ACI. The session will provide a review of the most important topics from the two VMware NSX + Cisco Nexus/ACI design guides already published, while adding additional “lessons learned” from real deployments in the field since those publications.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7514R - PowerNSX and PyNSXv: Using PowerShell and Python for Automation and Management of VMware NSX for vSphere
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Regardless of whether you are a Windows guru, or dream in awk and sed, there are powerful command-line and scripting tools as well as programing language bindings available to you for managing VMware NSX for vSphere environments. This session will take a light hearted but informative look at two tools, PowerNSX and PyNSXv, that enable you to query, manage, manipulate and automate your VMware NSX for vSphere platforms. Whether you are a PowerShell Guru or a Python Savant, this session has you covered. Leave any preconceptions or bias at the door, as through a series of comparative demonstrations, we will demonstrate the real power and flexibility that command-line, scripting tools and language bindings can bring to a VMware NSX for vSphere environment, regardless of which camp you come from.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC7836R - Introduction to Security with VMware NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware NSX is the network and security virtualization platform for the Software-Defined Data Center. In this session we will discuss the need for network virtualization and the problems that NSX solves, provide an overview of the key use-cases, and introduce you to the rich NSX partner ecosystem. This is a high-level session to prime you on NSX and point you to further sessions that dive deeper.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8193R - The Architectural Future of Network Virtualization
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Network virtualization is now deployed in the data centers of hundreds of enterprises and service providers. The technology has found a wide range of applications across use cases that range from automation to microsegmentation to data center pooling and disaster recovery. So what's next for network virtualization? This technical deep dive will take an "under the hood" look at network virtualization, examining the underlying architecture and its ongoing evolution. We will look at how the system is becoming more scalable through the use of clustering and the division of labor between the management, control, and data planes. The Data Plane Development Kit and flow caching are being used to boost data plane performance. We will discuss the evolution of the logical routing architecture, which will allow more complex routing topologies. Throughout the presentation, we'll tie the technical material to the expanding set of use cases that network virtualization is addressing and show how we will deliver networking and security services to any workload, anywhere—across hypervisors, across multiple clouds, and to a wide range of endpoints.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8039 - Bridging Virtual and Physical in NSX with Open vSwitch Database Management Protocol-Based Hardware VXLAN Tunnel Endpoint Integration
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware NSX allows the integration of partner switching platforms for performing the bridge between virtual and physical networks (extending VXLAN-backed logical switches in NSX to VLANs in the nonvirtualized world). After evaluating the real needs for this functionality and identifying some alternate solutions, this session will concentrate on the Open vSwitch Database Management Protocol (OVSDB) standard-based approach. The presentation will - Include a technical description of the components involved in the control plane and the data plane - Describe best practices and caveats for the deployment, including the example of redundancy models - Highlight some best practices and practical design recommendations - Walk through a configuration and present a recorded demo

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8935 - NSX for Small Data Centers—Breaking Boundaries
PresentationDetailsList.Description: When deploying VMware NSX, certain requirements and best practices simply must be followed. For instance, the NSX Reference Guide recommends having three clusters: management, compute, and edge. But what if you have a flat or single-cluster design in place already? Or your data center footprint is very small and you do not have enough compute resources for separate cluster? Or your hyper-converged system vendor has restrictions? Does this mean you cannot deploy NSX? The answer is, no, not at all. So how do you design and deploy NSX in such a scenario? That is what we will be talking about in this session.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC7628 - Use NSX to Automate Your Security Incident Response so You Can Stay Above Water
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Although the majority of today's data center workloads are virtualized, we are only now starting to take advantage of virtualization as a tool for security. The virtualization layer provides the best mix of isolation and context for security, making automatic detection, alerting, isolation, and remediation possible. This session provides details on what you can do now by leveraging VMware NSX and VMware's management and automation tools.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7857R - Reference Design for SDDC with NSX and vSphere: Part 1
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This is the first part of a two-part session covering reference design for Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC) with VMware NSX. This part covers best practices and design considerations for all NSX components. It starts with best practices in defining fabric topology, VMware vSphere cluster considerations, and deployment of each control plane component (NSX Manager, VMware NSX Controller). The next session covers compute and edge cluster design best practices with VXLAN Layer 2 tunnel endpoints (VTEPs) and Virtual Disk Service. The last part covers edge cluster components and distributed routing. The session ends with design best practices with Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) and Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) with equal-cost multipath routing (ECMP). Attendees are strongly encouraged to also attend part 2 to further their understanding of the NSX use case, design toplogies, and advanced security and services features. To assure you have the necessary background in NSX, try to attend these additional sessions: - VMware NSX—A Technical Deep Dive - NSX for vSphere Logical Routing Deep Dive - VMware NSX Distributed Firewall Deep Dive

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8675r - The Practical Path to NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Hundreds of customers have been deploying VMware NSX. In this session we will discuss the path customers are taking to adopt NSX and network virtualization. This session will cover the key use cases customers are embracing today. We will answer a number of questions, including where to start with NSX and how, and how partner integrations can help our customers. We will discuss outcomes customers can realize with NSX and how the new NSX features can help. Day 2 operations are critical when adopting any new technology, and we will use demos to show how NSX can easily integrate into an existing infrastructure. Whether in a greenfield or a brownfield use case, NSX can quickly be integrated into the environment and bring the benefits of the Software-Defined Data Center.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC9609-SPO - Trusted Security in the Software Defined Data Center: Real-World Use Cases Across VMware Platforms, including NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: We know by now that the Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC) automates provisioning and massively reduces time-to-market for applications and services. However, many organizations are still relying on legacy physical server security to protect their SDDC. When securing your hybrid cloud environments it is imperative that you incorporate a layered security architecture that includes anti-malware, IDS/IPS, firewall, integrity monitoring and log inspection to maximize protection against the next big attack. In this session, industry analyst Jon Oltsik of the Enterprise Strategy Group (ESG) will host a discussionof Trend Micro customersaround proven security practices with a cross-section of industry leaders from organizations such as the University of Pittsburgh and Integra Networks.The panelists will provide insight into the value of a SDDC built on VMware NSX including how to extend the benefits of micro-segmentation with advanced security controls that enable elastic protection throughout the life-cycle of a VM. In addition, they will describe how they protect their virtualized servers, VDI desktops and cloud environments, all through a single integrated platform.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8734 - Automating Networking and Security Operations with NSX Customer Panel
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Many customers are using VMware NSX to automate their networking and security operations, bringing the speed and agility to adapt to shifting demands and priorities of business, and the consistency needed to ensure a high quality of service, all while reducing operational expenses and without compromising on security. Attend this session to hear stories from a panel of customers about their own experiences of adopting NSX to deliver services and applications to the business faster, with more agility, and more consistently.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET9156 - Customer Case Study: Journey to Automate Security As a Part Of Service Delivery
PresentationDetailsList.Description: During last 6 years California Natural Resources Agency(CNRA) has been transforming information technology services and operations through virtualization, cloud, and software defined technologies and employment of a shared-services and service provider model to become an effective business enabling IT organization. Leveraging a state-of-art network virtualization platform and best-in-class next-generation firewall capabilities the Department of Water secures IT service delivery while monitoring key metrics and performance indicators that form the foundation of any sound security strategy. The journey towards a secure software defined data center has been a delicate balance between maintaining sustainable operations and continued innovation. By pooling our shared experiences together, we will talk about our successes and miss-steps taken throughout our journey.

Presenters.Name: Joel Rich, Department of Water Resources
Presenters.LastName: Joel Rich, Department of Water Resources

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7861R - Multisite Networking and Security with Cross-vCenter NSX: Part 2
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Cross-VC NSX enables logical networking and security across multiple vCenter domains/sites and provides enhanced solutions for multi-site deployments. In Part 2 of this session, we’ll discuss Cross-VC NSX Security, failure/recovery scenarios, and how automation can be leveraged in Cross-VC NSX environments for specific use cases/scenarios.We’ll walk through examples of Cross-VC NSX security. Further, we’ll step through the process of automating Failover/Recovery and take a look at how automation using different tools can be leveraged to handle the process. A demo will be shown covering some of the discussion points.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7760 - Enhanced Disaster Recovery with NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Traditional approaches to Disaster Recovery are complex, expensive and unreliable, requires synchronizing the physical infrastructure between the sites in order to recover applications. Software Defined approach to Disaster Recovery completely decouples the underlying infrastructure from the DR design thereby simplifying the recovery process. In this session we will cover how NSX can simplify your Disaster Recovery designs by keeping the networking and security between the sites fully in sync. We will walkthrough a DR solution with NSX and Site Recovery Manager (SRM) demonstrating how to seamlessly recover application compute, storage and networking/security infrastructure. You will also learn how to operationalize DR deployments and automate the recovery process.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7854R - Multisite Networking and Security with Cross-vCenter NSX—Part 1
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Learn how Cross-vCenter NSX (Cross-VC NSX) enables logical networking and security across multiple vCenter domains/sites and how it provides enhanced solutions for specific use cases. No longer is logical networking and security constrained to a single vCenter domain.We’ll step through an overview of the Cross-VC NSX feature and discuss architecture, components, and deployment models. We’ll also cover design topics and demonstrate how Cross-VC NSX can be used for multi-site solutions. A demo will be shown covering some of the discussion points.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8903 - Stories from the Alexandria SDN Zone
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Enterprises are making the move to a software defined approach for their data centers. But how about the rest of the enterprise, the WAN and the branch office? Today these areas are dominated by a “zombie” infrastructure approach. Innovation has become a “no go” dead zone for major parts of the IT Enterprise landscape. Fear not, there is hope. At VMWorld 2016, we will provide a panel session themed on the hugely popular TV show, the Walking Dead. The panelists will include a group of forward thinkers who are adapting the enterprise with a software networking approach using SDWAN and NSX to overcome the zombie network hordes.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8680R - Advanced NSX Troubleshooting: Tips & Tricks for Experienced Users
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The average cost of a data breach in the US is $5.8 million. Knowing how to troubleshoot key NSX features can not only improve security, but also give you more control of your networking environment. Give us an hour and we’ll give you an overview of the Command Line Interface (CLI) with detailed steps and commands you can use in your troubleshooting process. Then we’ll share six troubleshooting tips for critical areas of your NSX environment including host preparation, bootbank and boot process, ESXi Agency Manager (EAM), system events and logs, Virtual Extensible LAN (VXLAN) and controller pool.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC9976-SPO - Extending security beyond the SDDC with VMware NSX and Palo Alto Networks VM-Series Virtualized Next-Generation Firewall
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Since its introduction, the joint integration between Palo Alto Networks VM-Series Virtualized Next-Generation Firewall and VMware NSX has addressed the security and automation challenges seen within software defined data centers. In this session, we will discuss the challenges, opportunities and new business opportunities feasible with the joint integration extending beyond the on premise software defined data center. Topics covered will include, •Extending uniform security posture into ROBO (Remote Office/Branch Office) deployments •Protecting VDI (Virtual Desktop Infrastructure) environments •Securing hybrid cloud deployments

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8131R - NSX for vSphere Logical Routing Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The VMware NSX for vSphere platform brings agility to networking by decoupling the logical network space from the physical infrastructure. This session discusses how Layer 3 (L3) communication can be enabled between virtual and physical workloads. This session will offer technical detail (including packet walks) on how L3 communication is enabled in logical space. This is done both for intra-data center traffic flows (E-W traffic flows) as well as communication to the external L3 physical infrastructure (N-S traffic flows). This session will also go over deployment models and VMware vSphere High Availability options.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC8730 - NSX Security and Micro-segmentation Customer Panel
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Many customers are choosing VMware NSX for the transformative improvement of security efficiency and effectiveness in the data center. In this panel session, customers will be sharing the security aspects of their perspective and choice of VMware NSX. Hear stories about their own experiences of adopting NSX for micro-segmentation to enable a fundamentally more secure data center.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8241 - Monitoring and Troubleshooting NSX with vRealize Network Insight (Arkin)
PresentationDetailsList.Description: If you are wondering how to convince your team to take on the responsibility for NSX operations OR you are a network administrator who wants to understand which tools to use to manage physical and virtual networks and how to get to the problems quickly. Then, in this session you will learn about the Arkin and Log Insight tools. We will introduce you to the tools and capabilities briefly, and then jump into scenario based demos taking real life examples around Security and Network operations and NSX specific V+P monitoring and troubleshooting activities.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7834r - Introduction to VMware NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware NSX is the network and security virtualization platform for the Software-Defined Data Center. In this session we will discuss the need for network virtualization and the problems that NSX solves, provide an overview of the key use-cases, and introduce you to the rich NSX partner ecosystem. This is a high-level session to prime you on NSX and point you to further sessions that dive deeper.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7944 - NSX Brownfield Deployment Best Practices
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This session will cover design considerations of how VMware NSX can be incrementally and seamlessly deployed in existing customer data center environments. Specifically, the session will discuss how existing physical workloads, physical services, and Infrastructure can integrate with NSX. We will describe design options for consuming third-party physical firewalls and load balancers. Specific case studies concerning data center migration, security for east-to-west traffic, and operations will be also covered in detail.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC7568 - Practical NSX Distributed Firewall Policy Creation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The distributed firewall in NSX is a powerful tool capable of providing industry-leading microsegmentation. One of customers' common considerations is how to best create a zero-trust security policy in their existing environment, where the application ports and protocols used may not be well understood. This session will discuss multiple examples of how customers have successfully addressed these needs with tools such as Cisco NetFlow, syslog, flow monitor, and port mirror.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8731 - IT Automation with NSX Network Virtualization and Security
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Today, enterprises are being held back by their physical networking and security infrastructure. Manual configuration decreases an enterprise's speed, agility, and security and increases the risk of downtime and security incidents due to errors. In this session we will cover automation solutions for NSX network virtualization and security. We will discuss how enterprises are automating provisioning and configuration management for their networking and security infrastructure and achieving more speed, agility, and consistency—with much better economics for their operating expenses.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC9968-SPO - Automate Check Point vSEC Advanced Security with NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In the world of the Software-Defined Data Center, there is a need to protect traffic between virtual machines from laterally moving threats. Perimeter-based security solutions are very effective in protecting North-South traffic moving into and out of the data center. However, the same security approaches used for perimeter security are not able to keep pace with dynamic changes inherent in a virtualized datacenter. In order to optimize the benefits of the Software-Defined Data Center, security requirements must be addressed in an automated, integrated manner without impacting features or performance. Join us to learn about real-life lessons from the trenches of Check Point vSEC and VMware NSX based customers who are paving the way to fully realize the benefits of a Software Define Datacenter – without compromising on their security. See a live demo of how seamless and easy it is to auto-provision security, detect and quarantine infected machines and centrally manage your virtual and physical environments.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC9618-SPO - Deep Dive:  Extending L4-L7 Security Controls for VMware NSX and VMware Integrated OpenStack (VIO) Environments with Fortinet Next Generation Security
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Are you an adopter of VMware Integrated OpenStack (VIO)? Are you also a huge fan of VMware NSX?
With version 2.5 of VMware Integrated OpenStack (VIO), VMware introduced the ability to integrate VMware NSX. With that integration and the NSX-V version of VMware NSX you can now take advantage of NSX-integrated security solutions which can layer in L4-L7 advanced security controls.
VMware NSX and Fortinet FortiGate-VMX are closely integrated with the direct purpose of introducing L4-L7 advanced security controls for the VMware Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC). Automated deployment/orchestration, dynamic grouping, policy and policy re-direction enables granular security controls for your mission critical applications.
A successful security incursion or attack can result in a variety of devastating consequences including financial loss, damage to brand reputation, and loss of customer trust. Most organizations do not recover from a major security breach, making it absolutely critical to protect your users and customers from targeted threats.
Please join Fortinet experts as well as VMware guest(s) for an in depth discussion of examples, implementation and use-cases on how to utilize this integrated security solution with your VMware NSX and Integrated OpenStack (VIO) environments.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC9972-SPO - Deep Dive: Secure your multi-tenant cloud with Palo Alto Networks VM-Series and VMware NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware and Palo Alto Networks have collaborated to deliver granular visibility, control and advanced threat prevention within your NSX powered Software Defined Data Center. With the recent release and general availability of Panorama /PAN-OS 7.1 software, Palo Alto Networks VM-Series NSX edition enhances the integration with support for securing multi-tenant deployments. Multi-tenancy offers advanced capabilities like hosting multiple tenants on the same NSX environment and being able to isolate traffic for security inspection with VM-Series Next Generation Firewall. Tenants can use unique or duplicate IP address schema among themselves. All these deployment models are now supported through centralized management using Panorama. This session will provide an advanced technical overview of the enhancements done over last 12 months. The topics covered will include, • Technical overview of secure multi-tenancy deployment • Use-cases and operational workflows • Demos showcasing the enhancements.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8729 - NSX on Cisco ACI Customer Panel
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Many enterprises rely on both VMware NSX and Cisco infrastructure to build the foundation of their data center infrastructure. While VMware NSX brings advanced network automation and security capabilities to vSphere on any network infrastructure, this panel you will hear stories from VMware NSX customers about their own experiences of adopting NSX on top of a Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI).

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7837 - Introduction to Application Continuity with VMware NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Businesses continue to demand greater agility, security, and availability from the application infrastructure. With VMware SDDC, the infrastructure continues to evolve to meet these critical application needs. In this session we will cover the role of VMware NSX in aiding application continuity and delivering business agility. We will discuss how NSX can be used to expedite disaster recovery by synchronizing networking and security across locations and significantly reducing recovery time. And how NSX can be used to create a unified and resilient pool of networking and security infrastructure to run your applications anywhere – achieving high availability, disaster avoidance, and faster response times. We will also look at how NSX helps to deliver workload mobility via hot/cold migrations for scenarios like facility consolidation, data center migration, and capacity expansion. Finally, we will touch on how NSX helps to achieve application continuity use cases with significantly less hardware and operational expense.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7935 - Container Orchestration and Network Virtualization
PresentationDetailsList.Description: When moving from a developer desktop, or standalone container host environment, to a larger production type multi-container-host deployment, you will quickly encounter the limitations of the default-networking models inside of the various container orchestration and PaaS platforms. VMware is enabling advanced networking capabilities using NSX in these platforms. In this session we will focus on:- Docker ‘Swarm’ container orchestration platform- Kubernetes, the open source container cluster manager championed by Google- VMware's CNA projects - VMware integrated containers and Photon-PlatformWe will show you how we plan to integrate NSX in these platforms, and how NSX will enhance network manageability and security in them. We will go into technical details of the possible implementations, and show you live demos of early prototypes of some of the integrations.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7656-SPO - Accelerating SDDC through mainstream adoption of network virtualization
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In the same way that Hewlett Packard Enterprise and VMware led the industry in fostering mainstream adoption of x86 server virtualization, HPE and VMware are now focused on unlocking the untapped potential in today data center by accelerate the adoption of network virtualization. This session will detail how the HPE VMware (NSX) OEM agreement helps customers automate their data center network fabric and deploy their applications faster and more securely.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8193R - The Architectural Future of Network Virtualization
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Network virtualization is now deployed in the data centers of hundreds of enterprises and service providers. The technology has found a wide range of applications across use cases that range from automation to microsegmentation to data center pooling and disaster recovery. So what's next for network virtualization? This technical deep dive will take an "under the hood" look at network virtualization, examining the underlying architecture and its ongoing evolution. We will look at how the system is becoming more scalable through the use of clustering and the division of labor between the management, control, and data planes. The Data Plane Development Kit and flow caching are being used to boost data plane performance. We will discuss the evolution of the logical routing architecture, which will allow more complex routing topologies. Throughout the presentation, we'll tie the technical material to the expanding set of use cases that network virtualization is addressing and show how we will deliver networking and security services to any workload, anywhere—across hypervisors, across multiple clouds, and to a wide range of endpoints.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC7836R - Introduction to Security with VMware NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware NSX is the network and security virtualization platform for the Software-Defined Data Center. In this session we will discuss the need for network virtualization and the problems that NSX solves, provide an overview of the key use-cases, and introduce you to the rich NSX partner ecosystem. This is a high-level session to prime you on NSX and point you to further sessions that dive deeper.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7834 - Introduction to VMware NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware NSX is the network and security virtualization platform for the Software-Defined Data Center. In this session we will discuss the need for network virtualization and the problems that NSX solves, provide an overview of the key use-cases, and introduce you to the rich NSX partner ecosystem. This is a high-level session to prime you on NSX and point you to further sessions that dive deeper.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7857R - Reference Design for SDDC with NSX and vSphere: Part 1
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This is the first part of a two-part session covering reference design for Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC) with VMware NSX. This part covers best practices and design considerations for all NSX components. It starts with best practices in defining fabric topology, VMware vSphere cluster considerations, and deployment of each control plane component (NSX Manager, VMware NSX Controller). The next session covers compute and edge cluster design best practices with VXLAN Layer 2 tunnel endpoints (VTEPs) and Virtual Disk Service. The last part covers edge cluster components and distributed routing. The session ends with design best practices with Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) and Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) with equal-cost multipath routing (ECMP). Attendees are strongly encouraged to also attend part 2 to further their understanding of the NSX use case, design toplogies, and advanced security and services features. To assure you have the necessary background in NSX, try to attend these additional sessions: - VMware NSX—A Technical Deep Dive - NSX for vSphere Logical Routing Deep Dive - VMware NSX Distributed Firewall Deep Dive

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8675 - The Practical Path to NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Hundreds of customers have been deploying VMware NSX. In this session we will discuss the path customers are taking to adopt NSX and network virtualization. This session will cover the key use cases customers are embracing today. We will answer a number of questions, including where to start with NSX and how, and how partner integrations can help our customers. We will discuss outcomes customers can realize with NSX and how the new NSX features can help. Day 2 operations are critical when adopting any new technology, and we will use demos to show how NSX can easily integrate into an existing infrastructure. Whether in a greenfield or a brownfield use case, NSX can quickly be integrated into the environment and bring the benefits of the Software-Defined Data Center.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET9381 - Operationalizing NSX Customer Panel
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This session will take you into the day 2 operations of real customer deployments. Attendees will learn how NSX has transformed network and security operations to better manage scale, agility, and availability in the data center.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SEC10019 - VMware NSX Micro-segmentation – Definition & Benchmark Deep-Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Micro-segmentation is foundational to securing the software-defined data center, as it is paramount in maintaining and enhancing the security posture of dynamic workloads. Micro-segmentation allows automated and “baked-in” security, enabling significant security benefits as organizations move to an increasingly fine-grained segmentation approach for data-center security (e.g., Zero-Trust Architecture). This method wraps security controls around much smaller groups of resources – often down to a small group of resources or individual virtual machines. The inherent security and automation capabilities of the NSX platform makes micro-segmentation operationally feasible in the enterprise data center for the first time. But as with any new technology, one must understand how micro-segmentation fits into their current data center security architecture. This session will delve into how different micro-segmentation design patterns enabled by VMware NSX enhances your data center security posture, and will present the results of micro-segmentation benchmarking performed by an independent risk management & compliance auditing organization Coalfire Systems, Inc.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET9152 - VMware NSX—Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware NSX provides a complete reproduction of networking and security services in software. This session will offer a technical understanding of the components of NSX. You will learn how switching, routing, firewalling, load balancing, and other services work within NSX. We will discuss overlay networks and logical networks and how everything comes together on a physical infrastructure. You will also learn how security rules can be applied to logical networks with NSX. Demonstrations will be presented to highlight the key workflows.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET10884 - Moving to the next level of the SDDC - a Public Agency introduces VMware NSX, AirWatch, and Palo Alto Networks integration
NET9004-QT - Virtually Unstoppable: Scaling NSX to Bridge the Gap between Security & Cloud Automation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: It no longer about the cloud. It now the number of clouds required to keep business moving. This reliance requires careful balance, especially when security is paramount. While one values open access and flexibility, the other requires control and uniformity. Bolting on applications, security and other tools — often at the detriment of cloud operations, which are burdened with latency, complexity and reduced flexibility — is no longer acceptable. This all-or-nothing approach often leaves customers with two options: DIY or have a partner do it all. In this 30-minute breakout session: • Gain behind-the-scenes access to Armor unique use of VMware NSX • Learn how enterprise and security teams can bridge the gap between robust cloud infrastructure and data security • Explore Armor fourth-generation NSX-based infrastructure and the Armor Management Portal, which pair automation to deliver the flexibility and security customers expect from today cloud • Witness how IT teams can easily leverage real-time visibility for both infrastructure and security • Prioritize initiatives to help reduce the internal conflict between security and DevOps, while providing organizations with the appropriate balance between cloud flexibility and proven data security.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8769-QT - Hyper-convergence in Healthcare:  The Key to Doing More with Less
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Mike Feld, Interim CTO at Baystate Health in Springfield, Massachusetts and CEO of VertitechIT, addresses the current trend in healthcare datacenter infrastructure to a tightly bound integration of storage, computing, and networking elements resulting in a hyper-converged platform. This strategic and tactical session will take attendees through the step-by-step decisions that need to be made to implement a solution. Content will address the financial implications, scalability, resiliency, and alignment with public cloud storage solutions.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET9382-QT - A Software-Defined Data Center in Overseas Bases and Military Operations
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
The UK Ministry of Defense has embarked on a major transformation program, a new style of IT, wherein the complete IT landscape will be modernized using standard/commodity IT components. This represents a major shift away from vertically integrated solutions, which have proven to be inflexible and extremely expensive to maintain. Underpinning this transformation is vSphere, which is seen as a standard building block on which to create a software-defined future. The first phase has been to deploy several cloud platforms in conjunction with Hewlett Packard Enterprise (for development/test/production). VMware NSX has been used as the key enabler to automate the build of the environments, as well as to provide micro-segmentation between the stages, thus creating an integrated but secure environment that will allow the MOD to migrate applications through the development lifecycle. In addition, HPE is using NSX to provide internal security for the software-defined data centers that they are deploying into overseas military bases (NSX, vSphere, vSAN, vROPs). In doing so, they are extending the life of existing infrastructure, deferring spend on physical firewalls and netting millions of dollars in savings.
 
This technical deep dive will go into why this new approach was a necessity, and how HPE and VMware worked together to provide an integrated solution: HPE cloud automation with VMware NSX, vROPS, and vSAN.

Presenters.Name: Amarjit Manic, Hewlett Packard Enterprise Services
Presenters.LastName: Amarjit Manic, Hewlett Packard Enterprise Services

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7774 - Day Two NSX Operations in VMware's Private Cloud
PresentationDetailsList.Description: With great scale comes great responsibility for uptime, environment health, and maintenance. VMware Private Cloud is one of the world largest deployments of NSX for vSphere, hosting over 20,000 virtual machines (VMs). How has VMware structured its organization to support this environment? Our varied support team had to face a multitude of learning curves to support the underlying technologies of NSX. What processes and tools do we use for troubleshooting? In addition to providing this info, we will discuss how to address ongoing administration and upgrade tasks
